content.description: View the questions before you start the survey (external link)

list: Your response helps us to provide real-time information during the coronavirus (COVID-19) outbreak.
This is so the government has the information it needs to manage the UK’s response to the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic.

content.description: Thank you for completing this survey at this challenging time.

list: Information should relate to the UK.
You do not need to provide actual data.
We will treat your information securely and confidentially.

questions.question: Section one: Financial performance of your business

content.description: This section asks for information on any changes during the last two weeks, and expectations for the next two weeks, to:

list: your business's trading status
your business's turnover
your business's imports and exports
the availability and prices of materials, goods and services
your business's financial resources

questions.question: Section two: Operational performance of your business

content.description: This section asks for information on any changes to the size and capacity of your workforce during the last two weeks and expectations for the next two weeks.

questions.question: Section three: Other financial or operational changes

content.description: This section asks for information on any other changes to financial and/or operational activities in the last two weeks not already covered, and expectations over the next two weeks.

blocks.title: Financial performance of your business
blocks.description:
This section asks for information on any changes during the last two weeks, and expectations for the next two weeks, to:

  • your business's trading status
  • your business's turnover
  • your business's imports and exports
  • the availability and prices of materials, goods and services
  • your business's financial resources

questions.title: Is {{ metadata['ru_name'] }} currently trading?

options.label: Yes, the business is currently trading
options.value: Yes, the business is currently trading

options.label: No, the business has temporarily closed or paused trading
options.value: No, the business has temporarily closed or paused trading

options.label: No, the business has permanently ceased trading
options.value: No, the business has permanently ceased trading

values: Yes, the business is currently trading
No, the business has temporarily closed or paused trading

options.label: Yes, the business started trading again  in the last two weeks
options.value: Yes, the business started trading again  in the last two weeks

options.label: No, the business had not temporarily closed or paused trading in the last two weeks
options.value: No, the business had not temporarily closed or paused trading in the last two weeks

questions.title: Has {{ metadata['ru_name'] }} applied for any of the following initiatives?

options.label: Coronavirus Job Retention Scheme
options.description: UK government scheme that covers 80% of pay (up to 2,500 a month) for furloughed staff

options.label: Accredited finance agreements
options.description: For example, COVID Corporate Financing Facility (CCFF) or Coronavirus Business Interruption Loan Scheme (CBILS or CLBILS)

options.label: England-only government-funded small business grants or loan schemes
options.value: England-only government-funded small business grants or loan schemes
options.description: For example, the Small Business Grants Fund (SBGF) and Retail, Hospitality and Leisure Grant Fund (RHLGF)

options.label: Devolved government-funded small business grants or loan schemes in Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland
options.value: Devolved government-funded small business grants or loan schemes in Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland
options.description: These are schemes offered by the devolved governments for businesses operating in these countries

options.label: The business has not applied for any of these initiatives
options.value: The business has not applied for any of these initiatives

values: Coronavirus Job Retention Scheme
Business rates holiday
Deferring VAT payments
HMRC Time To Pay scheme
Accredited finance agreements
England-only government-funded small business grants or loan schemes
Devolved government-funded small business grants or loan schemes in Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland

blocks.title: Operational performance of your business
blocks.description:
This section asks you for information on any:

  • changes to the size and capacity of your workforce during the last two weeks
  • expectations over the next two weeks
  • intentions to use coronavirus (COVID-19) initiatives to manage business performance

questions.title: Was {{ metadata['ru_name'] }}'s workforce able to meet the demands of the business in the last two weeks?

options.label: Yes, the workforce could meet the business's demands
options.value: Yes, the workforce could meet the business's demands

options.label: No, the workforce could not meet the business's demands
options.value: No, the workforce could not meet the business's demands

questions.title: Which of the following measures has {{ metadata['ru_name'] }} taken to cope with the impact of coronavirus (COVID-19) on its workforce?

options.label: Laying off staff in the short term
options.value: Laying off staff in the short term

options.label: Recruiting staff for the short term
options.value: Recruiting staff for the short term

questions.title: In the last two weeks, roughly what proportion of {{ metadata['ru_name'] }}'s workforce was working in the following ways?
questions.description: Your answers should add up to 100%. If your workforce did not fall into one of the categories, enter '0'.

answers.label: Working at their normal place of work
answers.description: Include those who are normally remote workers

answers.label: Working remotely instead of at their normal place of work
answers.description: Exclude those who are normally remote workers

questions.title: In the last two weeks, roughly what proportion of {{ metadata['ru_name'] }}'s workforce was furloughed, off sick due to coronavirus or has been made redundant?
questions.description: Your answers should add up to 100%. If your workforce did not fall into one of the categories, enter '0'.

answers.label: On furlough leave
answers.description: Under the terms of the UK government's coronavirus Job Retention Scheme

answers.label: Off sick or in self-isolation due to coronavirus (COVID-19) with statutory or company pay

options.value: Expect workforce size to stay the same
